ovalButton

Class OvalButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.AbstractButton
            • javax.swing.JButton
              • ovalButton.OvalButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class OvalButton
extends javax.swing.JButton
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    This class represents an oval button. This means that the button will only trigger an acton if it is clicked within the oval shape drawn on it. The button can be also of circular shape (if width=height), or capsule shape (either horizontal or vertical capsule).
    Version:
    23 December 2018
    Author:
    Luka Kralj
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Construct a default oval button.

      • OvalButton

        public OvalButton(int shape,
                  int orientation)
        Construct an oval button with the specified shape and orientation.
        Parameters:
        shape - Shape of the button. Select one of the constants.
        orientation - Orientation of the button. Select one of the constants.

      • OvalButton

        public OvalButton(int shape,
                  int orientation,
                  java.awt.Color colorNormal,
                  java.awt.Color colorHighlighted,
                  java.awt.Color colorBorderNormal,
                  java.awt.Color colorBorderHighlighted)
        Construct a button and specify its colours.
        Parameters:
        shape - Shape of the button. Select one of the constants.
        orientation - Orientation of the button. Select one of the constants.
        colorNormal - The main color of the button.
        colorHighlighted - The color of the button when it is highlighted (hovered over etc.).
        colorBorderNormal - The main border color of the button.
        colorBorderHighlighted - The border color that will show whenever the button is marked as being highlighted (will remain this color even after the mouse exits).

        Set the main color of the button.
        Parameters:

      • setColorBorderNormal

        public void setColorBorderNormal(java.awt.Color colorBorderNormal)
        Set the main border color of the button.
        Parameters:
        colorBorderNormal - Color we want to set.

      • setColorBorderHighlighted

        public void setColorBorderHighlighted(java.awt.Color colorBorderHighlighted)
        Set the border color that will show whenever the button is marked as being highlighted (will remain this color even after the mouse exits). Independent of hover highlighting.
        Parameters:
        colorBorderHighlighted - Color we want to set.

      • setBorderThickness

        public void setBorderThickness(int borderThickness)
        Set the thickness of the border on the button. Set to 0 if you do not want any border.
        Parameters:
        borderThickness - Thickness in pixels.

      • setRadius

        public void setRadius(double newRadius)
        Set radius of the capsule-shape button. Setting radius to 1 produces the same effect as SHAPE_OVAL. Setting radius to 0 makes the button rectangular. Setting radius of the oval-shaped button will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        newRadius - New radius: between 0 and 1.

      • setHighlightedBorder

        public void setHighlightedBorder(boolean isHighlighted)
        Parameters:
        isHighlighted - True if you want this button's border to be highlighted, false otherwise.

      • addActionListener

        public void addActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener l)
        This method is overridden because it adds additional checks before executing the action specified by the user of the button.
        Overrides:
        addActionListener in class javax.swing.AbstractButton
        Parameters:
        l - ActionListener specified by the user.

      • getBorderThickness

        public int getBorderThickness()
        Returns:
        Thickness of the current border on the oval.

      • isBorderHighlighted

        public boolean isBorderHighlighted()
        Returns:
        True if the border is currently highlighted, false otherwise.

      • isValidClickPosition

        protected boolean isValidClickPosition(java.awt.Point screenPosition)
        Check if the position is withing the borders of the current shape of the button.
        Parameters:
        screenPosition - Position we want to check. It must be a position on the screen - not component dependent.
        Returns:
        True if this point is withing the shape of the button, false otherwise.

      • getBackgroundImage

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBackgroundImage()
        Should return the image that we want to set as the background. This image will be rendered within the oval/capsule shape of the button, but not outside of it. Return null if you do not want image as the background. In this case a background color will be used.
        Returns:
        Image for the oval/capsule, or null to use a background color.
